name: Dr. Sarah Chen
bio: University lecturer specializing in data science. 8 years teaching experience. Known for clear explanations and structured approach.

strengths.notes: Deep Python and data analysis knowledge, can answer advanced questions on the fly
Consistently finishes on time, has internalized pacing
Builds concepts step-by-step with clear scaffolding
Professional but warm, students respect her but she can feel distant to beginners

growth_areas.notes: Struggles with complex multi-group activities, prefers whole-class instruction
Tends to lecture when discussion stalls rather than using probing questions
Prefers prepared material, less comfortable going off-script

python-data-analysis.notes: Published researcher in data science, teaches this daily

hands_on.notes: Slightly runs over on hands-on exercises

transitions.notes: Takes a bit longer on transitions between activities

growth_nudges: Try opening with a hands-on warm-up instead of a lecture introduction — your explanations are strongest when students have context from trying something first
When discussion stalls, try a think-pair-share instead of reverting to lecture — it gives quieter students a low-stakes entry point
